intro: Hieracium diaphanoides subsp. ladikense, commonly known as the Ladikense hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. This subspecies is notable for its limited distribution and is often found in specific microhabitats within its native range.
